reviewText:
This is NOT a free-2-play game.

It's a DEMO of a game. You find the exact same limitations in demos as the 'free version' of this game places on you.
To put it bluntly, you are not going to get more time out of this product than you are from a demo of any other game UNLESS you start buying boosters.

The question then comes, of course, is it worth it to buy boosters?
For me, looking at prices and taking my experiences while trying out the mislabeled DEMO, the answer became a resounding NO.

Doing the story missions (which I did to get every unlock possible in the demo) was somewhat ok. A bit repetitve at times, due to the limitations of the game, but at least the battles were somewhat balanced.

Ability to get cards for free seemed limited to the few you got in the limited amount of solo-play missions available. The only currency in the game is hard cash, and it's not something you can 'earn' by playing (not in any games I tried at least), but purely something you pay to get boosters.

Most of the time when I queued up for online battles against other players, it told me that nobody was available to play against. So I had to alt-tab and do random stuff in a web-browser while trying to even GET games going online against other players.

Any of the battles I tried against other players were horribly horribly mismatched. There was no way the deck I was supplied with as a 'freebie'(or demo player) would compete with the decks of people I met (every one of the ones I met seemed to have paid and played for a while, given their levels and cards).

Randomization also have a huge effect on battles, meaning what initially looked like a balanced battle (as the ones I encountered in the solo missions) can turn onesided very quickly by a combination of cards gotten and mana orb placement. Battles that are already onesided can become extremely pointless beyond hope because of this too (like where my level 3 drake was put up against a level 30 drake by the matchmaking).

Unless you are planning to spend ALOT of money over a period of time to buy boosters as time goes by, steer clear of this one. The variety also seemed close to non-existent in the games I played, despite meeting levels and drakes of different types.

The poor balance, non-varietyof battles, lack of ability to progress without paying for it (coupled with the prices per time you actually consider if you should purchase something) ultimately turned me off from the game once I found out that I had exhausted the demo of its potential in a matter of 4 hours...

Some cute ideas, but ultimately flawed in execution on how they go about trying to handle the 'distribution model'.
voteText: 118 of 121 people (98%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: Drakerz really wants you to spend money, as half the monsters are locked behind paywalls (and there arn't that many to choose from). However, the game is poorly translated from French, is kinda buggy under its clean interface, and the card text isn't easy readable at higher resolutions. The unskippable and insulting tutorial tried to break on me twice, and the game itself crashed once for no apparent reason. The option to buy physical cards and combine them with a web cam for augmented reality is interesting, but given the above problems I really can't advise anyone to give it a try.

reviewText:
Despite the entire issue with the games initial download and installation (to call it horrible, nightmarish and painful would be understatement), I found the game to be really interesting.
The game essentially has two components: an augmented reality one, using a webcam and physical cards and a virtual only game (which currently is what you are playing on steam). The actual gemplay revolves around using your creature to battle the other player, using a mixture of physical attacks and spell cards. In many ways, you can think of it as using cards to fight with pokemon.
Be warned that the game is, in essence, pay to win due to the CCG nature of the game. Furthermore, since you are drawing from a deck, you are hit a little bit by RNG as well.
On the negative sides, I find the English translation to be lackluster and the developers really need to spend the money to fix that before it would be accepted by an English speaking country. Furthermore, there are a lot of bugs in the game as well, but seeing how this IS an open beta version of the game, then I'm fine with that at THIS time.
Overall, I found myself rather impressed by the game and I am currently considering putting some money up for it on kickstarter.

reviewText:
Not really as fun as its advertisement. You are given a choice of using 1 out of 6 dragons, with each dragon having a basic super power. You battle an opponent dragon in a sumo ring and hammer the crap out of the opposing dragon until it runs out of HP. It's like a lesser Pokemon fight.

PROS
1. Dragons
Dragons are always enticing but that's is all there is.

2. Novelty
It's definitely new.

CONS
1. It's not fun
It's really draggy as most the game is trying to dish out damage and manuveur to the opponent's flank.

2. Paywall
Those dragons don't come free.

3. VR/Augmented Reality
Nope. You can see it on your PC screen too. Nothing fancy.

reviewText:
DRAKERZ started of as an augment reality trading card game, in which you need a webcam and actual physical cards to play the game, but they added a 'virtual mode' which you can play the game with a keyboard and mouse without the webcam and physical cards, which is good because options are good. Playing the game for a bit i had fun playing it, and i love how there is movement and directions to worry about and control rather than only focusing on numbers and stats, plus it looks great graphically speaking. If your having problems with the download (i also had it) just reset it and hope it doesn't get stuck again (unfortunately that's how i solved my problem but solved never the less)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N_IltYrLcso

UPDATE: The only con you will see in the game from what other people are saying is probably the unbalanced matches. That's about it.

More info here: KSalue[www.ksalue.com]

reviewText: DRAKERZ-Confrontation 7/10 (with alot of hope for the future)\n\nThe concept is sound you have one monster card and you move it around a set arena to defeat the opponent with flanking and cornering. Your deck of 40 cards is made up of spell, weapons, interuptions, etc to add a intense battle experience. But the concept I apprechiated the most about this game is its sheer connection with the player. Let me explain. When playing TCG's or RPG's we gain the most connection when we create the character. For TCG's its deck types. We connect with a type of most or style and make it our own. In RPG's we like to place ourselves in the role of character going on adventures. This game ( be it very little at the moment) dose both. You create a deck to your play style and pick a monster that fits you, but then the game takes it a step further and allows to to alter that creatures apearance. This may seem a small thing but to those of us who watch animes like Digimon or Dragon Drive where you have one monster and thats all you get. This little step allows the player to connect to their Drako" making it yours. As of right now there are only 6 Drakos in the game but every part from wings
hoursPlayed: to horns can be changed. This game is only starting out and there are issues with translations but I for one am going to see it through and hope this game can pick itself up and stand tall with the big name TCG's."

reviewText: Overall I would say this is a good game. There are a few bugs that prevented me from trying out the daily tournaments. The game is pay to win, this is a fact. You get to pick a creature that you want to play with and they give you another 2 free to play creatures to play around with. You get the free to play card pack and it works pretty well if you can wisely use your mana and get good card draws. In order to get other creatures and other cards you have to buy the packs though, otherwise you won't get very far in the story mode or when versing other people online.There is no other way to get new cards, so the free to play" aspect only goes so far. If they gave players a way to actually earn cards it might be a great game."

reviewText:

To me this is still a 50/50 kind of game but for now from me it is a no.

reviewText:
I see a lot of peple saying bad things about the launcher and langague problems but when I downloaded it the launcher finished its update in less than two minutes and I was able to play. When it came to language I noticed some words were not translted yet, but most of it is in english and if there are any words still in french (I think thats the language) its not too hard to understand what it means, or what the button does unless its a name. The game works GREAT.

Drakerz is definitly a NEW type of card game, not just because it can be played in augmented realty (which is optional), but also because the machanics of the game are something never before seen (Or at least that I have have seen) in a card game and trust me I have played a lot of TCGs. Its all about your one Drako, your monster, your pet, your friend who you try to keep alive in battle. Theres no giant clutter of monsters on the feild that you have to keep track of, just one. The way you play is by moving your Drako across the battle feild, where you have to think very tacticaly on positioning and keeping your resource (Mana) in check to use special move against your enemy.

Now remember this game is still pretty new and it was made in a different country so of course there are going to be some issues, but that dosent mean you should walk away from the game. The team working on this game are actually doing their best to improve the game for others and are always answering questions so dont be afraid to ask too if you get a weird problem accuring.

Drakerz is definitly a game worthy of looking at if you like card games, or even stratagy games and even if you dont it might have some aspects or simplisty that any gamer would like. The best part is that you can play for free with the virtual starter pack and three free drako they give you, even if you go against people who have bought cards you still have a chance to beat them like I have. The cards you get are actually really good and the other cards you can get from the campaign mode only make your deck better. GIVE THIS GAME A CHANCE and if you already left it, GIVE IT ANOTHER CHANCE. I cannot even properly describe how much fun this game can be. Its totally worth it.

reviewText:
With the first few bit that I've seen and played, I have to say that it's been a very long time since I played a TCG that I actually enjoyed a lot. It built up from Pokemon, to YGO, to MTG but that was many years ago. This game caught my attention like PS3's Eye of Judgement (which unfortunately I can't find many people to play it, though it may be problems on my end) and feels like it has a bit more strategy to the game. I do like the idea that you are not only able to play the game online with digital or paperback cards, but you can even play with others locally without the computer (though you don't get all that interesting visuals).

I haven't received my physical cards yet, but to what I've seen and heard the artwork has been done very beautifully. I do hope that this game will continue to expand and become the next MTG or at least a worldwide game that will live a long time. I know it's just beginning, but I am hoping to see some interesting new creatures and strategy works for it.

My final rating: 7/10
Though the game is great, I feel that there can (and will) be more improvements.  One of the things I would like to see is the game feeling more lively when you're doing combat and going through the phases. And as people do say on the forums, there are still some things needing translating but other than that I think it's off to a decent start. I haven't run into the problem of the launcher not working so I can't say any of my frustrations about that, but I will give this a 9/10 when the game is fully released with all that fixed :)

reviewText:
It's crashed twice in a row, at the same place, during the tutorial.

EDIT: I don't know what's wrong but the game crashes doing the tutorial and because the tutorial is compulsary to play, I haven't been able to see anything else.

... anything else except the constant adds bashing me in the face since the first time I signed in with over priced pay-to-win cards and monsters. The translation... was not seamless. The Engrish" makes reading abilities and stuff sometimes impossible and understanding how the game works difficult.

Obviously
date: this game is great. Even just the fraction of the tutorials I got through were fun. This experience is UTTERLY RUINED by the pay-to-win system that funds their game
recommended: the Engrish that makes comprehension impossible and to make it worse there are constant adds being blasted in your face. Save your time and if you're silly enough ... the money. Do not download this game."

reviewText: This game is simply one of the most beatiful themed games :) i love the design of every creature.\nUI is very well done, looks typical french( seen other french studios use this white cool sleak design)\nNow gameplay is really amazing strategy wise, it does not only matters with the cards, but how you will posisionate your drako too. When you get into game you will have a starter deck that is ofcourse free. And i strongly recomend buying cards( mostly virtual card if you dont really care about the physical cards, since virtual is cheaper). Try this game out and see if you like it it is really unique. not at all like other tcg. and if you like it support them and buy some cards :)

reviewText: Alot of people complain about the Luancher, but it worked fine for me (a tad bit slow at checking files tho) the real problem is the game can be very finicky about cetain things, there's no indactor if you're actually in range to atk or not. I had high hopes for this game, but it just doesn't add up well. Here is why i did not enjoy DRAKERZ- Confrontation.

PROS:
Great concept
Classic card game feel
Pretty nice graphics

Cons:
Formentioned great concept is executed poorly
Pay to win scam
Horrible english translations.
Bad tutorial
Bad controls
A.I. is not that good
No customization

reviewText: The game still has a weird soundcard glitch that destroys your ear unless you reload the game a few times to get rid of that annoying bug. You can play the first newbie tournament, use 3 dragons but obviously without the real cards that you must purchase, there is nothing else for you to do. It is like playing a demo of a game but without the chance to test their AR features without purchasing. It is not a Free to Play, just a demo. Overall I enjoyed playing it until I beat the newbie campaign but nothing else. It has potential but its niche is restricted to the tabletop cards to squeeze it fully. Graphics are OK, sound is glitchy as hell and too repetitive, gameplay is enthralling but nothing else beyond that. Purchase the cards and enjoy the tournaments and unlocked potential you can't enjoy for free.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Alright... Let's be honest, this game is not really a free to play.

However, I really like it ! I follow the game since his very beginning and I always had fun and a real challenge playing it, even with my basic cards.

Yes you may have to pay if you want to unlock the full story mode (doesn't interest me) or having cards a bit faster and I agree with people complaining about that, it's a kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ part.

BUT what if I told you there is an other way to win cards ? The playable story parts give you cards when winning, 1 for each completion and actually only like 10 free but it's a good start.
Then practice against people and take part of an online tournaent, 1 each hours and saturday's tournaments winner earns a virtual booster.

This game is not totally free-to-play, the way to have more cards is either money, either skill, I personally do have the second one and I'm waiting for some challengers.

PS: the game freaking need an active community, lobbies are empty as hell :/

reviewText:
A real card game with many dimensions !

You can chose your monster (Drako) among 06 : Felis - Gorok - Kwartz - Meleon - Furkhan and Ogam.
Each drako has a diferent power that lets you play with many combinations of cards.

The game is free to play and you can get many virtual cards with the story mode. After that, you can easily carry to play against real players :)

Several mode are available in this game (history, tournaments, challenges ...) and of course the opportunity to play with a friend and his webcam provided buy some real cards will recall that many hours of play on games like this: p

If you want more information on the action of the game, follow the link :
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/968346344/drakerz-augmented-reality-tcg/posts/858888



---------------



Pour les Français,

Essayez, vous l'adopterez à coup sûr ;)

reviewText: Despite the greatness of its own style of gameplay that brings the TCG type of game up a new level, there still a slight problem with the launcher as mentioned by most of the players who played this game. I already facing the problem when patching the game via launcher which is it keep failing about each 10mb of patching so I need to resume the patch each time it fail. Plus, this game is not really free-to-play as described because each augmented deck can be play as you pay for it so the free version only gives you limited set of cards in your deck which is helpless for you to survive through the campaign and even harder in multiplayer mode where only those who pay can win the game.

reviewText: I really liked this game, it had potential. The idea of trading cards combined with Augmented reality just seemed so good. The community was one of the friendliest game communities I had seen. The Drakos are costumizable in that you unlock different colors for wings, tail, horns, etc.\nI left for a few months, but when I came back, I was shocked to find the lobby showing 0 players online. A game I wanted so badly to succeed is now empty.  I will recommend this game to represent the fun it was when the community was more active.\n
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
When I first tried this game i was blown away. It was pretty good. No problems starting it up so I'm confused about the people down there. I'd have to agree that the game is pretty much a demo and advertises everywhere about buying the premium version.

Pros: 3 pretty good characters to choose from
Very fun
You get the first set of customization from the demo
You can still play with other players even if you're not premium.
VERY fun with a friend.

Cons :(   : Game just smashes into your brain to buy the full version.
Can't get good cards without paying for the premium version.
Can't get more customizations without the premium version.
Can't get more characters without the premium version.
Can't get the full storyline without the premium version.



Still a good game if you play with a friend though. Other than that you have to buy the premium version to properly play the game.

reviewText:
I can't recommend this game, only for the fact that customer service on their website is terrible.

I placed an order a year and a half ago. Haven't gotten my cards and when I asked to cancel my order, they said my address was wrong when shipped. When I first placed my order my zip code was wrong but I had contacted them beforehand and they said they had fixed it.

After replying to them with this I hadn't heard anything since. And I still haven't gotten my refund.

Before this incident I rather did enjoy the game.
